title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the query tab's data set editor
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the query tab's data set editor, the children nodes are not being listed.
OB: No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: The expected result is that the children nodes should be listed when changing the data source.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page.
3. Change the data source.
Actual Result: The new data source does not display any database/table/column information.

To resolve this issue:
1. Close the data set editor.
2. Reopen the data set editor.
